title: Fifa officials 'corrupted football'
desc: US prosecutors accuse Fifa officials of racketeering fraud and money laundering involving tens of millions of dollars over a 24-year period.

title: EU states 'must take 40000 migrants'
desc: The European Commission urges EU states to take in 40000 asylum seekers from Syria and Eritrea who land in Italy and Greece in the next two years.

title: WW2 bomb prompts Cologne evacuation
desc: Some 20000 people in the German city of Cologne are forced to leave their homes as authorities defuse a one-tonne bomb from World War Two.

title: Blair quits Middle East envoy role
desc: Former UK Prime Minister Tony Blair is to stand down from his role as Middle East envoy representing the US Russia the UN and the EU sources confirm.

title: Queen's Speech for 'working people'
desc: An EU referendum tax freezes and a boost for working people are among the plans unveiled in the first Conservative Queen's Speech in nearly two decades.

title: US military shipped Anthrax to labs
desc: The US military accidentally sent live Anthrax samples to multiple labs from Utah but officials say no one was exposed.

title: IS 'driven from Assyrian villages'
desc: Islamic State fighters have been driven out of Assyrian Christian villages they had seized in north-eastern Syria in February activists say.

title: Arrests over Pakistan 'fake degrees'
desc: Pakistani investigators detain the head of a global internet technology firm suspected of an alleged multi-million dollar fraud selling fake degrees online.

title: Marriage vote 'defeat for humanity'
desc: A landmark vote to allow same-sex marriage in the Republic of Ireland is a defeat for humanity a senior Vatican official says.

title: No let-up in massive India heatwave
desc: Heatwave conditions continue to sweep India where more than 1100 people have died in the past week officials say.

title: Texas dam holds after severe storms
desc: A large part of the southern US continues to recover from deadly floods brought on by powerful weekend storms.

title: Nigeria fires 'cowardly soldiers'
desc: Nigeria's army sacks at least 200 soldiers for cowardice and failure to fight against Boko Haram militants several soldiers tell the BBC.

title: VIDEO: Seven Fifa officials arrested in Zurich
desc: Swiss police have arrested seven leading officials from football's world governing body Fifa in a dawn raid on suspicion of accepting and paying millions of dollars in bribes.

title: VIDEO: Delhi's women suffer under heatwave
desc: The BBC's Zubair Ahmed reports from a village near Delhi where women are working all day under the blazing sun to earn just four dollars a day in order to feed their children.

title: VIDEO: Extreme weather wreaks havoc in US
desc: Extreme weather has been wreaking havoc in the US where at least 17 people have been killed by storms in Oklahoma and Texas.

title: VIDEO: Where war still rages in eastern Ukraine
desc: The conflict in Ukraine is entering its second year and a ceasefire nominally in place since February has failed to stop the violence in areas around Donetsk airport.

title: VIDEO: Turning Van Gogh into virtual reality
desc: An American artist has turned Van Gogh's The Night Cafe into an immersive virtual reality experience.

title: VIDEO: Photo project addresses Lebanon racism
desc: BBC News hears how an exhibition is highlighting Lebanon's ethnic diversity to address racism.

title: VIDEO: Turkey's fast train to success?
desc: Will Turkey's infrastructure projects such as this high-speed train prove to be a vote-winner for the governing AK Party?

title: VIDEO: Taking a dip in the King's Cross Pond
desc: Tim Muffett reports as a revival of lidos has revived interest in outdoor swimming.

title: The Iraq syndrome
desc: Repercussions of the war in Iraq will be felt not just there but globally for many years to come says Nick Bryant.

title: Why Venezuelans worry more about food than crime
desc: Why have food shortages and inflation overtaken security as Venezuelans' prime concern in a nation that has high levels of violent crime?

title: Ukraine's civilians living on frontline
desc: Fergal Keane travels to Pisky on Ukraine's frontline to discover why an elderly couple refuse to leave their destroyed and deserted hometown.

title: Solar Impulse awaits 'moment of truth'
desc: In what will be its greatest challenge yet the zero-fuel aeroplane Solar Impulse will soon try to fly non-stop from China to Hawaii - a journey of more than 8000km across the Pacific Ocean.

title: Nash's ground-breaking ideas
desc: John Nash the US mathematician who has died aged 86 made an enduring contribution to his field writes maths lecturer John Moriarty.

title: Who are Israel’s Ethiopian Jews?
desc: Protests over the beating of an Ethiopian Israeli soldier have thrown the spotlight on the Ethiopian Jewish community in Israel writes Prof Yossi Mekelberg.

title: VIDEO: Man covered in bees sets record
desc: A man in China Gao Bingguo sets a new world record after coating his body with bees.

title: China 'morality bank' for good deeds
desc: Account holders earn points for helping in the community.

title: Trader kept Libor 'artificially high'
desc: The trader at the centre of the Libor rate-rigging trial tried to influence other banks to manipulate the key benchmark rate a court hears.

title: CBS 'probably' in Apple TV deal
desc: The chief executive of CBS says the US TV network will 'probably' sign a deal with Apple TV.

title: AdBlock Plus wins again in court
desc: The makers of an advert-blocking browser plug-in defeat a second attempt to ban their product this year.

title: Criminals steal US tax returns
desc: A security breach at the United States' Internal Revenue Service has allowed criminals to gain access to more than 100000 tax returns.

title: Broadway enjoys record season
desc: New York's theatreland enjoys its best ever season for 2014-2015 breaking box office and attendance records.

title: Mans Zelmerlow climbs UK chart
desc: Swedish Eurovision winner Mans Zelmerlow soars to number five in the mid-week music chart with his upbeat song Heroes.

title: Robots adapt to damage in seconds
desc: Researchers develop robots that adapt to damage in less than a minute instead of the many hours needed by traditional self-learning systems.

title: Mice in space develop thin skin
desc: A study of three mice that spent 91 days on the International Space Station finds abnormalities in their skin.

title: Excess caffeine health warning - EU
desc: Drinking more than five espressos worth of caffeine a day may be damaging to health according to the European Food Safety Authority.

title: Kenya payout over birth control
desc: A Kenyan court orders a private hospital to pay $48000 (£31000) to a woman who became pregnant despite having a contraceptive implant.

title: Lucic-Baroni stuns third seed Halep
desc: Third seed and 2014 runner-up Simona Halep is knocked out of the French Open by world number 70 Mirjana Lucic-Baroni.

title: Boss Advocaat leaves Sunderland
desc: Sunderland boss Dick Advocaat is to leave the club after guiding the Premier League side to safety this season.

title: Sending ice to Antarctica
desc: Scientists have come up with a new way of preserving samples of ice from mountain glaciers. They are creating an ice vault in the coldest place on Earth - Antarctica.

title: The falcon hospital of Qatar
desc: Hunting with falcons is a popular sport in the Gulf - and Qatar's capital city Doha has a specialist hospital where injured birds are treated.

title: Hungary's mandatory Holocaust course
desc: Hungary university requires every student to study the Holocaust.

title: Meet YouTube's 8-bit movie makers
desc: A team which recreates popular films as 8-bit video games is attracting millions of views on YouTube.

title: Madagascar MPs vote to sack leader
desc: Parliamentarians in Madagascar vote to impeach President Hery Rajaonarimampianina in a surprise move.

title: S Lanka drops cricket officials
desc: Sri Lanka's cricket body says officials accused of harassing female players have been removed but that there are no grounds for criminal proceedings.

title: Danish PM calls snap June election
desc: Denmark's prime minister calls an election for 18 June when her centre-left coalition is expected to face tough a challenge from the opposition.

title: Twin corruption inquiries at Fifa
desc: Two criminal inquiries into corruption at football's world governing body Fifa are under way as seven high-ranking officials are arrested in Zurich.

title: Dozens killed in Sanaa air strike
desc: Saudi-led coalition warplanes have bombed a special forces camp in Yemen's capital Sanaa killing at least 36 people officials and witnesses say.

title: Santorum joins race for US president
desc: Rick Santorum a Christian conservative who came second in the 2012 Republican primaries for president launched a second campaign for the White House.

title: Triple murder deaths 'unimaginable'
desc: The family of the victims in a suspected triple murder in Didcot describe it as an unimaginable tragedy.

title: Ex-MP sentenced for teen assaults
desc: Former Falkirk MP Eric Joyce who was convicted of attacking two teenagers in an unjustified and unprovoked assault is sentenced.

title: Boy eight dies playing in cemetery
desc: An eight-year-old boy dies and two 10-year-olds are injured in a tragic accident involving a falling headstone at a cemetery in Glasgow.

title: Man jailed for trying to join IS
desc: A British man who attempted to join Islamic State in Syria is jailed for six years.

desc: Celebrations at the 60th anniversary show in Vienna

title: In pictures: Inside an Indian high court
desc: Rare access - an Indian high court at work

desc: Ben Weller has been taking pictures of South Korea's markets

desc: Readers' images on the theme of looking in

desc: From around the world - 16-22 May

desc: Alison Baskerville's photos of women in Somaliland

desc: The 40 year conflict that remains unresolved

desc: How swimwear has changed over a century

desc: City booms under Turkey's Islamist-rooted government

title: The man who hid behind a trail name
desc: How a US hiking tradition helped hide a fugitive

desc: The myth that British teeth are bad

desc: The blog calling out gender imbalance on panels
